issue.name: Robots.txt file
issue.description: The web server contains a robots.txt file.
issue.caption: /robots.txt

issue.name: TLS certificate
issue.description:
The server presented a valid, trusted TLS certificate. This issue is purely informational.

The server presented the following certificates:

Server certificate

Issued to:  *.herokuapp.com, herokuapp.com
Issued by:  DigiCert SHA2 High Assurance Server CA
Valid from:  Mon Jun 15 00:00:00 GMT 2020
Valid to:  Wed Jul 07 12:00:00 GMT 2021

Certificate chain #1

Issued to:  DigiCert SHA2 High Assurance Server CA
Issued by:  DigiCert High Assurance EV Root CA
Valid from:  Tue Oct 22 12:00:00 GMT 2013
Valid to:  Sun Oct 22 12:00:00 GMT 2028

Certificate chain #2

Issued to:  DigiCert High Assurance EV Root CA
Issued by:  DigiCert High Assurance EV Root CA
Valid from:  Fri Nov 10 00:00:00 GMT 2006
Valid to:  Mon Nov 10 00:00:00 GMT 2031

Certificate chain #3

Issued to:  DigiCert High Assurance EV Root CA
Issued by:  DigiCert High Assurance EV Root CA
Valid from:  Fri Nov 10 00:00:00 GMT 2006
Valid to:  Mon Nov 10 00:00:00 GMT 2031

issue.name: Strict transport security not enforced
issue.description: This issue was found in multiple locations under the reported path.

issue.name: Cacheable HTTPS response
issue.description: This issue was found in multiple locations under the reported path.

issue.name: Cross-domain script include
issue.description:
The response dynamically includes the following scripts from other domains:
  • https://cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/cookieconsent2/3.1.0/cookieconsent.min.js
  • https://cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/jquery/2.2.4/jquery.min.js

issue.name: Cross-origin resource sharing: arbitrary origin trusted
issue.description:
The application implements an HTML5 cross-origin resource sharing (CORS) policy for this request that allows access from any domain.

The application allowed access from the requested origin https://tjyljfnakuiu.com

If the application relies on network firewalls or other IP-based access controls, this policy is likely to present a security risk.

Since the Vary: Origin header was not present in the response, reverse proxies and intermediate servers may cache it. This may enable an attacker to carry out cache poisoning attacks.
issue.caption: /robots.txt
